question: Compare the number of 'Quantitative' metrics between the Mortgage Finance and Asset Management & Custody Activities industries.
optionA: The Mortgage Finance industry has 4 'Quantitative' metrics, while the Asset Management & Custody Activities industry has 3.
optionB: The Mortgage Finance industry has 2 'Quantitative' metrics, while the Asset Management & Custody Activities industry has 4.
optionC: The Mortgage Finance industry has 3 'Quantitative' metrics, while the Asset Management & Custody Activities industry has 3.
optionD: The Mortgage Finance industry has 2 'Quantitative' metrics, while the Asset Management & Custody Activities industry has 3.
optionE: Both the Mortgage Finance and Asset Management & Custody Activities industries have 3 'Quantitative' metrics each.
reference_text: For the Mortgage Finance industry, the 'Quantitative' metrics listed in Table 1 are: FN-MF-450a.1, FN-MF-450a.2.
For the Asset Management & Custody Activities industry, the 'Quantitative' metrics listed in Table 1 are: FN-AC-410a.1, FN-AC-1, FN-AC-2, FN-AC-3.
pairing_explanation: Asset management and mortgage finance are pivotal in funding sustainable projects and investments, focusing on long-term economic and environmental impacts.

question: List the activity metrics for the Mortgage Finance and Asset Management & Custody Activities industries.
optionA: For Mortgage Finance: (1) Number and (2) value of mortgages originated / purchased by category - residential and commercial. For Asset Management & Custody: Total assets under management (AUM), Total assets under custody and supervision.
optionB: For Mortgage Finance: None listed. For Asset Management & Custody: Total assets under management (AUM), Total assets under custody and supervision.
optionC: For Mortgage Finance: (1) Number and (2) value of mortgages originated by category - residential and commercial. For Asset Management & Custody: None listed.
optionD: For Mortgage Finance: (1) Number and (2) value of mortgages purchased by category - residential and commercial. For Asset Management & Custody: Total assets under management (AUM).
optionE: For Mortgage Finance: (1) Number and (2) value of mortgages originated by category - residential and commercial, (1) Number and (2) value of mortgages purchased by category - residential and commercial. For Asset Management & Custody: Total assets under management (AUM), Total assets under custody and supervision.
reference_text: For the Mortgage Finance industry, the activity metrics listed in Table 2 are: (1) Number and (2) value of mortgages originated by category: (a) residential and (b) commercial, (1) Number and (2) value of mortgages purchased by category: (a) residential and (b) commercial.
For the Asset Management & Custody Activities industry, the activity metrics listed in Table 2 are: Total assets under management (AUM), Total assets under custody and supervision.
pairing_explanation: Asset management and mortgage finance are pivotal in funding sustainable projects and investments, focusing on long-term economic and environmental impacts.

question: What are the common sustainability topics between the Mortgage Finance and Asset Management & Custody Activities industries?
optionA: Environmental Risk to Mortgaged Properties, Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management & Advisory
optionB: Environmental Risk to Mortgaged Properties, Transition Risk Exposure
optionC: There are no common sustainability topics between the two industries.
optionD: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management & Advisory, Transition Risk Exposure
optionE: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management & Advisory
reference_text: For the Mortgage Finance industry, the sustainability topics listed are: Environmental Risk to Mortgaged Properties.

For the Asset Management & Custody Activities industry, the sustainability topics listed are: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Investment Management & Advisory, Transition Risk Exposure.
pairing_explanation: Asset management and mortgage finance are pivotal in funding sustainable projects and investments, focusing on long-term economic and environmental impacts.

question: What are the codes for all the 'Quantitative' metrics in Table 1 for the Asset Management & Custody Activities and Mortgage Finance industries?
optionA: FN-AC-410a.1, FN-AC-1, FN-AC-2, FN-AC-3, FN-MF-450a.1, FN-MF-450a.2, FN-MF-000.A, FN-MF-000.B
optionD: FN-MF-450a.1, FN-MF-450a.2, FN-MF-000.A, FN-MF-000.B, FN-AC-410a.1, FN-AC-1, FN-AC-2, FN-AC-3
reference_text: FN-MF-450a.1. (1) Number and (2) value of mortgage loans in 100-year flood zones
FN-MF-450a.2. (1) Total expected loss and (2) Loss Given Default (LGD) attributable to mortgage loan default and delinquency due to weather-related natural catastrophes, by geographic region
FN-MF-000.A: (1) Number and (2) value of mortgages originated by category: (a) residential and (b) commercial
FN-MF-000.B: (1) Number and (2) value of mortgages purchased by category: (a) residential and (b) commercial

FN-AC-410a.1. Amount of assets under management, by asset class, that employ (1) integration of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues, (2) sustainability themed investing, and (3) screening
FN-AC-1: Percentage of total assets under management (AUM) included in the financed emissions calculation
FN-AC-2: (1) Absolute gross (a) Scope 1 emissions, (b) Scope 2 emissions, and (c) Scope 3 emissions, and (2) associated amount of total AUM (i.e., financed emissions)
FN-AC-3: (1) Gross emissions intensity by (a) Scope 1 emissions, (b) Scope 2 emissions, and (c) Scope 3 emissions, and (2) associated amount of total AUM (i.e., financed emissions)
pairing_explanation: Asset management and mortgage finance are pivotal in funding sustainable projects and investments, focusing on long-term economic and environmental impacts.

question: Give me the codes for all the 'Discussion and Analysis' metrics in Table 1 for the Asset Management & Custody Activities and Mortgage Finance industries.
reference_text: FN-AC-410a.2. Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment and/or wealth management processes and strategies
FN-AC-410a.3. Description of proxy voting and investee engagement policies and procedures
FN-AC-4. Description of the methodology used to calculate financed emissions
FN-MF-450a.3. Description of how climate change and other environmental risks are incorporated into mortgage origination and underwriting

question: When preparing sustainability reports, how do the metrics for measuring incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors differ between the Asset Management & Custody Activities and Mortgage Finance industries?
optionA: There are no metrics related to ESG incorporation for the Mortgage Finance industry, while the Asset Management & Custody Activities industry has metrics FN-AC-410a.1, FN-AC-410a.2, and FN-AC-410a.3 covering this topic.
optionB: Both industries have similar metrics covering the incorporation of ESG factors, such as FN-MF-450a.3 for Mortgage Finance and FN-AC-410a.1, FN-AC-410a.2, and FN-AC-410a.3 for Asset Management & Custody Activities.
optionC: The Mortgage Finance industry has metric FN-MF-450a.3 related to ESG incorporation, while the Asset Management & Custody Activities industry does not have any metrics on this topic.
optionD: The metrics for measuring ESG incorporation are identical for both industries, using the same code FN-XYZ-123.
reference_text: FN-AC-410a.1. Amount of assets under management, by asset class, that employ (1) integration of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues, (2) sustainability themed investing, and (3) screening
FN-AC-410a.2. Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment and/or wealth management processes and strategies
FN-AC-410a.3. Description of proxy voting and investee engagement policies and procedures
FN-MF-450a.3. Description of how climate change and other environmental risks are incorporated into mortgage origination and underwriting
pairing_explanation: Asset management and mortgage finance are pivotal in funding sustainable projects and investments, focusing on long-term economic and environmental impacts.
